params._currentOwner: Address of the current relayer owner.
params._newOwner: Address of the new relayer owner.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: boolean True if address has DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE role.
boolean True if address has AUCTION_ORACLE_ROLE role.
boolean True if address can be a relayer.
boolean True if address has RELAYER_ADMIN role.
boolean True if address is a Relayer and not paused.
boolean True if address is a registered Relayer.
boolean True if _name is a Relayer.
boolean True if address owns a relayer.
boolean True if address can act as relayer factory.
boolean True if relayer address is paused by platform.
boolean True if address has SMART_CONTRACT role.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params._name: Human readable name of the Relayer.
params._relayer: Address of the Relayer contract. Must conform to IETSRelayer.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._platform: The new Platform address to set.

params._role: bytes32 representation of role being administered.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

platform.details: ETS Platform account. Core Dev Team multisig in production. There will only be one "Platform" so no need to make it a role.

changeRelayerOwner(address,address).notice: Change the relayer owner as stored in ETSAccessControls. Callable from Relayer only. Called via changeOwner() on a relayer.

getPlatformAddress().notice: Returns wallet address for ETS Platform.

getRelayerAddressFromName(string).notice: Get relayer address from it's name.

getRelayerAddressFromOwner(address).notice: Get relayer address from its owner address.

getRelayerNameFromAddress(address).notice: Get relayer name from it's address.

isAdmin(address).notice: Checks whether given address has DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE role.

isAuctionOracle(address).notice: Checks whether given address has AUCTION_ORACLE_ROLE role.

isRelayer(address).notice: Checks whether given address is a relayer.

isRelayerAdmin(address).notice: Checks whether given address has RELAYER_ADMIN role.

isRelayerAndNotPaused(address).notice: Checks whether given address is a registered Relayer and not paused.

isRelayerByAddress(address).notice: Checks whether given address is a registered Relayer.

isRelayerByName(string).notice: Checks whether given Relayer Name is a registered Relayer.

isRelayerByOwner(address).notice: Checks whether given address owns a relayer.

isRelayerFactory(address).notice: Checks whether given address can act as relayer factory.

isRelayerLocked(address).notice: Checks relayer is paused by ETS Platform.

isSmartContract(address).notice: Checks whether given address has SMART_CONTRACT role.

pauseRelayerByOwnerAddress(address).notice: Pause relayer given the relayer owner address. Callable by Platform only.

registerRelayer(address,string,address).notice: Adds a Relayer contract to ETS. Can only be called by address with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

relayerContractToName(address).notice: Relayer contract address to human readable name.

relayerLocked(address).notice: Mapping to contain whether Relayer is paused by the protocol.

relayerOwnerToAddress(address).notice: Relayer owner address to relayer address.

setPlatform(address).notice: Sets the Platform wallet address. Can only be called by address with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

setRoleAdmin(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Sets the role admin for a given role. An address with role admin can grant or revoke that role for other addresses. Can only be called by address with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

toggleRelayerLock(address).notice: Pauses/Unpauses a Relayer contract. Can only be called by address with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.
